'''Ballands Castle''' was a [[castle]] near the village of [[Penselwood]], [[Somerset]], England.
==History==
Balland Castle was a [[motte and bailey]] castle, probably built after the [[Norman conquest of England]] in 1066, near the village of Penselwood in Somerset.<ref name=CreightonP62>Creighton, p.62.</ref> The castle sits close to the contemporary Norman castles of [[Cockroad Wood Castle|Cockroad Wood]] and [[Castle Orchard]], and may have been built as part of a system of fortifications to control the surrounding area.<ref name=CreightonP62/>
The motte of the castle is now around 5 m high, and up to 9 m wide.<ref name=HER>''[http://www.somersetheritage.org.uk/record/54381 Balland's Castle, Penselwood]'', Somerset County Historic Environmental Record, accessed 18 July 2011.</ref> The bailey lies to the south, and both the motte and the bailey are surrounded by ditches.<ref>Creighton, p.62; ''[http://www.somersetheritage.org.uk/record/54381 Balland's Castle, Penselwood]'', Somerset County Historic Environmental Record, accessed 18 July 2011.</ref>
Today the castle site is a [[scheduled monument]].<ref>''[http://www.gatehouse-gazetteer.info/English%20sites/3238.html Balland's Castle]'', Gatehouse website, accessed 18 July 2011.</ref>
